citations.narrative:
The facility was not able to provide records of acquisitions, dispositions, or current inventory for their avian species at the
time of inspection. Appropriate documentation of acquired regulated animals, and complete and accurate records of
disposition and inventory are essential for proper identification of losses and are necessary to track animals used in
regulated activities to ensure their humane care, use, and disposition. The licensee must maintain acquisition and
disposition records for all covered animals, which includes the number of covered birds held, owned, acquired, or
disposed of including births, and deaths. To be corrected by: May 29, 2025.

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
At the time of inspection, the facility lacks an environmental enhancement plan for their birds that is approved by the
attending veterinarian, written or otherwise. Birds can experience mental distress when their environment is not enriched.
An adequate environmental enhancement program is essential in promoting the psychological well-being of birds.
Exhibitors must develop, document, and follow an appropriate plan for environment enhancement adequate to promote
the psychological well-being of birds, it must be in accordance with the currently accepted professional standards, and
approved by the attending veterinarian. To be corrected by: May 29, 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.75(b) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
The facility was not able to provide records of acquisitions, dispositions, or current inventory for their avian species at the 
time of inspection. Appropriate documentation of acquired regulated animals, and complete and accurate records of 
disposition and inventory are essential for proper identification of losses and are necessary to track animals used in 
regulated activities to ensure their humane care, use, and disposition. The licensee must maintain acquisition and 
disposition records for all covered animals, which includes the number of covered birds held, owned, acquired, or 
disposed of including births, and deaths. To be corrected by: May 29, 2025. 
3.154 
   
Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being. 
At the time of inspection, the facility lacks an environmental enhancement plan for their birds that is approved by the 
attending veterinarian, written or otherwise. Birds can experience mental distress when their environment is not enriched. 
An adequate environmental enhancement program is essential in promoting the psychological well-being of birds. 
Exhibitors must develop, document, and follow an appropriate plan for environment enhancement adequate to promote 
the psychological well-being of birds, it must be in accordance with the currently accepted professional standards, and 
approved by the attending veterinarian. To be corrected by: May 29, 2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
